properties.areaDesc: Central and Southwest Mountains; Southwest Wyoming; Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Southern Utah Mountains; Western Uinta Mountains; Wasatch Mountain Valleys; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 1 at 9:26AM MST until February 4 at 4:00AM MST by NWS Salt Lake City UT
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to
16 inches possible across the mountains, with 5 to 10 inches
possible across the Wasatch Back and southwest Wyoming. Winds
could gust as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...In Wyoming, Southwest Wyoming. In Utah, Wasatch
Plateau/Book Cliffs, Western Uinta Mountains, Wasatch
Mountains South of I-80, Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch
Mountain Valleys, Southern Mountains and Central Mountains.

* WHEN...From Sunday evening through late Monday night. The
period of heaviest snowfall is expected late Sunday night
through Monday morning, with snow lingering through the day
Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult across the region
Sunday night through Monday, with the Monday morning commute
being significantly impacted.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A strong cold front will bring a band of
heavy snow beginning late Sunday evening across northwest
Utah, then spreading south through the remainder of the area
Sunday night. Snow will continue into the day Monday, along
with much colder temperatures.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this storm system.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT
